alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 1:03AM PST until further notice by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Additional rainfall over Skokomish River Basin will drive the river back above flood stage today. More rain into the weekend will produce more flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 16.2 feet late this afternoon. It will then rise to flood stage again tonight. It will fall to 16.2 feet on Friday afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage again early Saturday morning to 17.0 feet midday Saturday. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 01/08/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 145 PM PST.
